isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.newOperator: The new operator, who will have the ability to deleverage accounts                     without first marking them and waiting the timelock period.

trade(address,address,address,uint256,by.details: Emits the LogDeleveraged event. May emit the LogUnmarkedForDeleveraging event.

params.price: The current oracle price of the underlying asset.
params.sender: The address that called the trade() function on PerpetualV1.

trade(address,address,address,uint256,by.return: The amounts to be traded, and flags indicating that deleveraging occurred.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

mark(address).notice: Mark an account as underwater. An account must be marked for a period of time before any non-admin is allowed to deleverage that account.

setDeleveragingOperator(address).notice: Set the privileged deleveraging operator. Can only be called by the admin.

trade(address,address,address,uint256,by.notice: Allows an underwater (less than 100% collateralization) account to be subsumed by any other account with an offsetting position (a position of opposite sign). The sender must be the privileged deleveraging operator unless the account has been marked as underwater for the timelock period.

unmark(address).notice: Un-mark an account which is no longer underwater.

userdoc.notice: Contract allowing underwater accounts to be deleveraged against offsetting accounts.
